page.title: 19PLANT LIFE AT PONTSTICILL
page.content: The landscape above the village of Pontsticill is mostly rough grazing land unsuitable for other forms of agriculture.The underlying Carboniferous Limestone has in many places collapsed to form funnel shaped swallow holes which pock mark the ground of this ancient plateau area. The plants to be found in this grassland area are low growing and small due to constant cropping by sheep and the effects of the wind. Among the plants to be found here are Tormentil,Thyme,Stitchwort and Herb Robert.The largest plants growing in the area are wimberry or bilberry bushes.These are low growing due to the sheep but they provide a delicious berry eaten by humans and sheep alike. In patches of wetter ground grow clumps of reed like plants the pith of which was used to make tallow candles.
